input_text:
Job Title: MATERIAL HANDLER I

Location: Tullahoma, TN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Manufacturing, Production, Supply Chain

Description:
At TE, you will unleash your potential working with people from diverse backgrounds and industries to create a safer, sustainable and more connected world. 

Receiving

Job Overview

Loads and unloads trucks and interfaces with common carriers.

Signs bill of ladings for incoming shipments and process IBL, packing lists for receipts from vendors using POLIS and WCS.

Checks incoming product against documentation to verify accuracy, sorts products and prepares it for put away.

Receive product into WCS using barcode scanners or CRT.

Put product away in available space by proper area/zone using order pickers, turret trucks, pallet jacks and barcode scanners

Picking

Picks products for customer orders, manufacturing orders and sample requests using barcode scanners, pick tickets, shipping papers, order pickers, turret trucks and manual or electric pallet jack.

Performs other put away and pick duties, such as bin location audits, unit load and carton transfers.

Weigh or hand counts quantities needed to fill customer orders, manufacturing orders and sample requests.

Packing

Performs packing function by reviewing WCS packing functions or ship sets to obtain packaging instructions.

Performs special packaging, prints and applies special labeling as required by each customer. Understands and follows the 107 specifications

Recognizes hazardous/flammable material and prepares for shipment per established procedures.

Shipping

Prepares cartons and pallet loads for shipment by attaching proper shipment documentation as well as carrier required documentation.

Prepares unit load shipments with stretch wrap or banding.

Generates manifests and bill of ladings for each shipment checking against actual carton count in staging area.

Contacts common carriers to arrange pick up for shipments.

Loads and unloads cartons to / from pallets, carts or conveyor by using forklift and manual or electric pallet jack.

This position is 1st shift 6 am 2:30 pm Monday to Friday with overtime as needed.

What Your Background Should Look Like

 Minimum of a high school education or GED  Ability to read and write English, follow verbal instructions and use simple math.  Experience using SAP is preferred.  Computer skills  Must be able to lift objects up to 55LB.  Ability to work overtime as business demands require.  Physical Demands – Regularly required standing & walking 

Competencies

Values: Integrity, Accountability, Inclusion, Innovation, Teamwork

About Te Connectivity

TE Connectivity is a global industrial technology leader creating a safer, sustainable, productive, and connected future. Our broad range of connectivity and sensor solutions enable the distribution of power, signal and data to advance next-generation transportation, renewable energy, automated factories, data centers, medical technology and more. With more than 85,000 employees, including 8,000 engineers, working alongside customers in approximately 140 countries. TE ensures that EVERY CONNECTION COUNTS. Learn more at

Compensation

 Competitive base salary commensurate with experience: $33,120 – $49,680 (subject to change dependent on physical location) Posted salary ranges are made in good faith. TE Connectivity reserves the right to adjust ranges depending on the experience/qualification of the selected candidate as well as internal and external equity. Total Compensation = Base Salary + Incentive(s) + Benefits

Benefits

 A comprehensive benefits package including health insurance, 401(k), disability, life insurance, employee stock purchase plan, paid time off and voluntary benefits.

EOE, Including Disability/Vets

Experience Level (if available): Associate
